content.text:
# Badagada Government High School, Bhubaneswar

|website        =
}}
Badagada Government High School, Bhubaneswar, is a high school in the capital city of Bhubaneswar, Odisha. The school was started in 1963 by the Government of Odisha. It is one of the oldest government schools in the city of Bhubaneswar along with the Capital High School, which was established a decade earlier. In 2013, Badagada Government High School, Bhubaneswar, celebrated its Golden Jubilee. The school is located at the corner of an old village called Badagada and a new housing complex built by Bhubaneswar Development Authority (BDA).
Description
The school is strategically located at the corner of an old village called Badagada and a new housing complex built by Bhubaneswar Development Authority (BDA). It is called the Badagada BRIT Colony. BRIT stands for Bhubaneswar Regional Improvement Trust which was the initial version of BDA.
Badagada High School is a Government of Odisha-owned high school in the capital city of Bhubaneswar. It is led by a headmaster, but effective administration and the budget are the responsibility of the Department of School and Mass Education, Government of Odisha.
The school has classes from 6th through 10th grades. It is affiliated to the Board of Secondary Education, Odisha of the Government of Odisha, which conducts the terminal 10th grade examination.
The typical class size is 50 students.
Teachers are appointed by the Government of Odisha.
Headmasters
These headmasters have served Badagada High School.
